text: Sprint football, formerly called lightweight football, is a varsity sport played by United States colleges and universities, under standard American football rules. The sport has two governing bodies—the Collegiate Sprint Football League, founded in 1934, and the Midwest Sprint Football League, founded in 2021 ahead of its first season in 2022. As of the upcoming 2024 season, 16 schools field sprint football teams—nine in the CSFL and seven in the MSFL. In sprint football, players must have a weight of 178 lb (81 kg) or less and a minimum of 5% body fat to be eligible to play. ==References== Category:Sports in the United States Category:American football
title: Sprint football
